intro: Echites cupulifer, commonly known as the cup-bearing echites, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant produces capsules as its fruit. Echites cupulifer is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
